cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 510 miles SE of New Orleans, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico, then turning north toward the southeast Louisiana coast and the lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana â€“ near the Mouth of the Mississippi River / Grand Isle area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cameron, LA to west of Intracoastal City, LA and from the Mouth of the Pearl River to the MS/AL border (Hurricane Watch); Sabine Pass to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA and Mobile Bay (Storm-Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans (Hurricane & Storm-Surge Warnings)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from eastern Texas across all of Louisiana into coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds likely (potential for category-3+ strength at landfall) with sustained winds well over 74 mph and higher gusts in the New Orleans area.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 7-11 ft possible from the Mouth of the Mississippi River eastward; 4-7 ft forecast in Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Borgne, threatening low-lying port facilities and levees.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8-16 inches with isolated totals up to 20 inches, causing significant flash and river flooding around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Risk of tornadoes Sunday into early Monday; life-threatening surf and rip currents; extended power outages and debris that could impede port operations.
